questions.question: What is your current role and level in the enterprise?

options.label: Individual Contributor (Engineer/Analyst)
options.description: Hands-on technical work, no direct reports

options.label: Senior IC / Tech Lead
options.description: Technical leadership, may guide others but not a people manager

options.label: Manager / Director
options.description: People management with technical oversight

options.label: Architect / Principal
options.description: Enterprise-level technical strategy and design

questions.question: What is your primary technical background today?

options.label: Software Engineering
options.description: Building applications, APIs, full-stack development

options.label: Data / Analytics
options.description: Data engineering, BI, analytics, some ML

options.label: Infrastructure / Cloud
options.description: DevOps, cloud architecture, platform engineering

options.label: Product / Strategy
options.description: Product management, business analysis, strategy

questions.question: What industry is your enterprise in?

options.label: Financial Services
options.description: Banking, insurance, fintech

options.label: Healthcare / Pharma
options.description: Health systems, life sciences, biotech

options.label: Technology / SaaS
options.description: Software company, tech platform

options.label: Other regulated industry
options.description: Government, energy, telecom, etc.

questions.question: What's your current AI/ML experience level?

options.label: AI-curious
options.description: Used ChatGPT/Copilot, no hands-on building yet

options.label: Hobbyist / Self-taught
options.description: Built personal projects, taken courses, experimented with APIs

options.label: Professional basics
options.description: Deployed at least one AI/ML solution at work

options.label: Experienced practitioner
options.description: Multiple production AI/ML projects, comfortable with the full lifecycle

questions.question: What kind of AI projects excite you most for enterprise adoption?

options.label: Process automation (Agentic AI)
options.description: AI agents that automate workflows, approvals, document processing

options.label: Knowledge / RAG systems
options.description: Enterprise search, knowledge bases, document Q&A for internal teams

options.label: Decision support / Analytics
options.description: AI-powered insights, forecasting, clinical or business decision aids

options.label: Customer/Patient-facing AI
options.description: Chatbots, virtual assistants, patient engagement tools

questions.question: What's your target role in 12-18 months?

options.label: AI Product Manager
options.description: Own AI product roadmap, work with engineering to deliver

options.label: AI Solutions Architect
options.description: Design AI solutions, evaluate vendors, create reference architectures

options.label: Innovation Lead / AI Strategist
options.description: Identify AI opportunities, build POCs, pitch to leadership for investment

options.label: Technical Program Manager (AI)
options.description: Coordinate cross-functional AI initiatives, manage from idea to handoff

questions.question: What's your biggest gap or concern about making this transition?

options.label: Technical depth in AI/ML
options.description: Need stronger hands-on skills to build credible prototypes

options.label: Enterprise stakeholder buy-in
options.description: Know the tech but struggle to get leadership/budget alignment

options.label: Visibility / internal network
options.description: People don't know I exist or what I can do

options.label: Lack of a portfolio
options.description: No concrete AI projects to point to as proof of capability

questions.question: Does your enterprise have an existing AI/innovation team or center of excellence?

options.label: Yes, formal AI/ML team
options.description: Dedicated team with budget, headcount, and roadmap

options.label: Informal / grassroots
options.description: A few people experimenting but no formal structure

options.label: No, I'd be pioneering this
options.description: No existing AI initiative — I'd be creating the path

options.label: Not sure
options.description: There might be one but I'm not connected to it

questions.question: How technical do you want your prototype work to be? This shapes the skill profile significantly.

options.label: No-code / low-code demos
options.description: Use tools like Copilot Studio, Vertex AI Agent Builder, or similar to build demos without writing much code

options.label: Code-assisted prototypes
options.description: Use AI coding tools (Copilot, Claude) to build functional prototypes — I write some code but lean on AI

options.label: Hands-on coding
options.description: I want to write Python, use LangChain/LangGraph, call APIs directly — build real POCs myself

options.label: Mix — depends on the project
options.description: Low-code for quick demos, hands-on for more complex POCs

questions.question: How many years of total professional experience do you have?

options.label: 3-5 years
options.description: Early career, building foundation

options.label: 6-10 years
options.description: Mid-career, established track record

options.label: 11-15 years
options.description: Senior professional, deep domain expertise

options.label: 15+ years
options.description: Veteran, significant leadership and domain depth

input.subject: Target role identified with rationale for fit
input.description: A specific target role (12-18 months) is selected from the options, with clear reasoning tied to the user's background, interests, and enterprise context

input.subject: Skills gap analysis with development priorities defined
input.description: Technical, strategic, and domain skills mapped against current state and target role. Gaps identified and prioritized into tiers (critical, important, nice-to-have)

input.subject: Career progression ladder mapped from current to target
input.description: Clear progression path showing current IC → target role → future growth, with what unlocks at each level in enterprise healthcare/pharma

input.subject: Profile updated with skills and project interests
input.description: Talent profile TELOS files updated with: target skills to develop, project types of interest, and positioning for internal discovery by enterprise collaborators

input.subject: Stakeholder buy-in strategy addresses biggest gap
input.description: Concrete approach for building enterprise credibility and getting leadership alignment on AI projects — the user's self-identified biggest gap

questions.question: Does this role target and career plan feel right? I'll use it to update your talent profile.

options.label: Yes, update my profile
options.description: The AI Innovation Lead path, skills tiers, and career ladder all resonate — write it to my profile

options.label: Mostly, but adjust the role title
options.description: The plan is right but I want a different target role name or framing

options.label: Need to rethink
options.description: Something feels off — let's discuss before committing to the profile

questions.question: What name should your profile use? (This is how people will find you internally)

options.label: Use my real first name
options.description: I'll tell you my preferred name

options.label: Keep it as 'User' for now
options.description: Use the placeholder name, I'll update later

questions.question: Does this reframed plan — focused on durable skills and the post-commoditization trajectory — feel right? I'll update your profile based on your answer.

options.label: Yes, this is it
options.description: The 'what stays scarce' framing resonates. Update my profile with this direction.

options.label: Yes, but I want to adjust emphasis
options.description: Mostly right, but I want to shift some priorities before you write it

options.label: Too far out — focus on the 12-18 month horizon
options.description: I appreciate the long view but need to focus on near-term moves first

input.prompt:
Search the codebase for any existing TELOS profile files. Look for:
1. Any files named SKILLS.md, EXPERIENCE.md, INTERESTS.md, AVAILABILITY.md, CERTIFICATIONS.md, DOMAIN_EXPERTISE.md
2. Any directory that looks like a TELOS directory (USER/TELOS or similar)
3. Any existing profile JSON files

Search broadly using Glob patterns like **/*SKILLS*.md, **/*TELOS*/, **/*profile*. Report what you find with full paths.

# Skills

## Technical Skills — Current

## Skills to Develop — Tier 1 (Critical, next 3 months)

| Skill | Current | Target | Why Durable |
|-------|---------|--------|-------------|
| Prompt Engineering & LLM APIs | Foundational | Intermediate | Foundation for every prototype; builds intuition for what's feasible |
| Agentic AI Frameworks (LangGraph/CrewAI) | Foundational | Intermediate | Top project interest; must demo credibly to earn investment |
| AI Business Case Architecture | Intermediate | Advanced | Converts prototypes to funded programs; stakeholder buy-in weapon |
| Healthcare AI Governance (NIST AI RMF, FDA) | Foundational | Intermediate | Regulatory judgment can't be automated; be the "can we do this?" person |

## Skills to Develop — Tier 2 (Strategic, months 3-9)

| Skill | Current | Target | Why Durable |
|-------|---------|--------|-------------|
| Organizational Change Management | Foundational | Intermediate | When everyone can prototype, the bottleneck is adoption |
| Cross-Domain Pattern Recognition | Intermediate | Advanced | Translating what works in fintech/retail to pharma = unique value |
| Enterprise Data Strategy | Foundational | Intermediate | Models commoditize, data doesn't; know where the enterprise gold is |
| Vendor Evaluation & Build/Buy/Partner | Foundational | Intermediate | Enterprises buy more AI than they build; deciding when = massive leverage |
| RAG Architecture Patterns | Foundational | Intermediate | Decision support systems need retrieval; core project interest |

## Skills to Develop — Tier 3 (Executive trajectory, months 9-18)

| Skill | Current | Target | Why Durable |
|-------|---------|--------|-------------|
| Board-Level AI Communication | None | Foundational | Translate AI implications into business risk/opportunity for non-technical leaders |
| AI Portfolio Management | Foundational | Intermediate | Manage a portfolio of AI bets like a VC — fund/kill/pivot on evidence |
| Enterprise Architecture Thinking | Foundational | Intermediate | How AI reshapes the entire operating model, not just individual solutions |
| Industry Thought Leadership | None | Foundational | Publishing, speaking, external reputation — creates gravity and compounds |

## Domain Skills

| Skill | Proficiency | Years | Last Used |
|-------|------------|-------|-----------|
| Pharmaceutical R&D Landscape | Advanced | 6 | 2026-02 |
| Regulatory Awareness (FDA/EMA) | Intermediate | 4 | 2026-01 |
| Clinical Trial Design (Concepts) | Foundational | 2 | 2025-12 |
| Healthcare Data Standards (FHIR/HL7) | Foundational | 0 | — |

## Soft Skills
- Translating between R&D scientists (biology language) and data scientists (ML language)
- Seeing across domains to spot where AI solves real workflow pain points
- Building cross-functional buy-in that gets projects from idea to pilot
- Constraint-first evaluation — mapping blockers before investing effort
- Executive storytelling — 3-minute pitch for every prototype, speaking in outcomes not technology
- Trust-based influence — building the sponsor relationships that convert ideas into investments

# Interests

## Professional Interests
- How AI capability curves affect R&D investment decisions
- Cross-functional collaboration patterns that actually work in pharma
- Structured evaluation frameworks that surface invisible constraints early
- The gap between "interesting AI research" and "deployed AI tools that scientists use"
- **Enterprise AI adoption at scale** — what makes organizations actually change how they work
- **Post-commoditization AI strategy** — when anyone can prototype, what stays scarce? (judgment, orchestration, governance)
- **Agentic AI for process automation** — AI agents that automate healthcare workflows, approvals, document processing
- **Decision support systems** — AI-powered insights, forecasting, clinical and business decision aids

## Project Types I Want to Work On
| Project Type | Interest Level | Why |
|-------------|---------------|-----|
| Agentic AI / Process Automation | High | Biggest near-term enterprise impact; automates visible pain points |
| Decision Support / Analytics | High | Combines domain expertise with AI; high-value in clinical settings |
| RAG / Knowledge Systems | Medium | Enables decision support; practical for internal knowledge management |
| Customer/Patient-Facing AI | Low | Prefer internal enterprise adoption first |

## Learning Goals
- [ ] Build 3-5 code-assisted prototypes (LLM APIs + agentic frameworks) to develop intuition
- [ ] Complete AI business case architecture framework for enterprise pitches
- [ ] Study NIST AI RMF + FDA AI/ML guidance to become the "can we do this?" person
- [ ] Deepen understanding of clinical trial endpoints and statistical design
- [ ] Learn enough about transformer architectures to evaluate feasibility claims
- [ ] Study successful AI deployments in pharma (case studies, failure modes)
- [x] Build a repeatable constraint-first evaluation framework (using PAI)
- [ ] Build a cross-industry AI patterns library (what works in fintech/retail → pharma translation)
- [ ] Study organizational change management for AI adoption (Prosci or equivalent)

## Mentoring Preferences
- **Willing to mentor on:** Cross-functional AI project evaluation, stakeholder management, constraint surfacing, AI opportunity identification
- **Seeking mentorship in:** Deep ML technical feasibility assessment, regulatory pathway knowledge, executive-level AI communication, enterprise data strategy
- **Preferred format:** Written async (structured questions → responses), supplemented with short syncs

input.new_string:
# Goals

## Career Transition Goal (2026-2027)
**Target Role:** AI Innovation Lead — the person who identifies the highest-value AI opportunities, proves they work, and orchestrates the organization to adopt them.

**Positioning Statement:** "I identify the highest-value AI opportunities in our enterprise, prove they work, and orchestrate the organization to adopt them." — This statement stays true whether prototyping takes 2 weeks or 2 hours.

## Q2 2026
- Select 3-5 high-impact AI projects for the AIXplore portfolio
- Ensure cross-domain buy-in before any project enters pilot phase
- Reduce idea-to-pilot timeline from 6 months to 8 weeks
- Build a repeatable evaluation framework that captures team constraints early
- Build 2 code-assisted prototypes (agentic AI + decision support) as proof of capability
- Develop AI business case template and pitch it to at least one VP sponsor

## Q3-Q4 2026
- Complete Tier 1 skills development (prompt engineering, agentic frameworks, AI governance, business case architecture)
- Launch at least 1 AI prototype that earns investment approval and handoff to delivery team
- Begin Tier 2 skills (change management, cross-domain patterns, data strategy, vendor evaluation)
- Build a "wins log" documenting every prototype, demo, and stakeholder reaction

## 2027
- Establish yourself as the enterprise go-to for "should we build this AI solution?"
- Begin Tier 3 skills (board-level communication, AI portfolio management, enterprise architecture)
- Start building external thought leadership (internal talks → conference talks → published insights)

## Ongoing
- Translate between R&D scientists (biology language) and data scientists (ML language)
- Surface invisible cross-functional constraints before they block projects at month 4
- Learn which constraint patterns predict project success vs. failure
- Apply the "what stays scarce" filter: prioritize skills and projects around judgment, orchestration, and governance over pure technical implementation

input.old_string:
## S5: 3-Month AI Displacement Test
Before investing evaluation effort in any project, apply the displacement test: "Will AI's exponential growth in 3 months make this work MORE valuable or OBSOLETE?" Projects that ride the AI curve (amplifiers) pass. Projects that compete with AI's trajectory (bespoke solutions AI will do better) fail. Apply this gate BEFORE constraint mapping (S1) to avoid sunk evaluation cost on strategically misaligned projects.
input.new_string:
## S5: 3-Month AI Displacement Test
Before investing evaluation effort in any project, apply the displacement test: "Will AI's exponential growth in 3 months make this work MORE valuable or OBSOLETE?" Projects that ride the AI curve (amplifiers) pass. Projects that compete with AI's trajectory (bespoke solutions AI will do better) fail. Apply this gate BEFORE constraint mapping (S1) to avoid sunk evaluation cost on strategically misaligned projects.

## S6: Proof Before Permission
Don't ask for a budget to explore AI. Build a prototype against a visible pain point, demo it to the person who owns that pain, and let the demo create the demand. A working 5-minute demo beats a 30-slide strategy deck. Find one VP sponsor who gets it — one champion is worth more than org-wide awareness.

## S7: Speak Outcomes, Not Technology
Healthcare execs care about: time-to-decision, error reduction, compliance risk, FTE hours saved. They don't care about: LLMs, RAG, agentic, embeddings. Every pitch, every demo, every email — translate technology into the outcomes they're measured on.

## S8: Build for the Post-Commoditization World
When AI prototyping is commoditized (and it will be), three things stay scarce: (1) judgment about WHAT to build, (2) ability to orchestrate organizational change, (3) governance and risk judgment in regulated domains. Invest disproportionately in these skills. Technical depth serves as credibility fuel, not as the core value proposition.

## S9: Compound Credibility Through a Wins Log
Document every prototype, demo, stakeholder reaction, and outcome in a running log. Each small win compounds into a portfolio that justifies bigger bets. The wins log becomes your budget justification, your promotion case, and your proof of capability — all in one artifact.

## S10: Create FOMO as a Strategic Tool
Track what competitors and peer enterprises are doing with AI. "Pfizer just deployed X" or "UnitedHealth reduced Y by 40% with AI" is a powerful motivator for enterprise leadership who otherwise delay decisions.

input.old_string:
# Mission

I identify and champion AI-driven R&D projects that accelerate drug discovery at AstraZeneca. I bridge the gap between what's scientifically possible and what's organizationally achievable.

My value is not in doing the science or building the models — it's in seeing across domains, spotting where AI can solve real workflow pain points, and building the cross-functional buy-in that gets projects from idea to pilot.

**Strategic Filter (2026-02-07):** I focus exclusively on projects that benefit from the exponential increase in AI capabilities. I deprioritize any project where the work will be obsolete within 3 months due to AI advancement. The test is binary: "Will AI's growth make this work MORE valuable (pursue) or OBSOLETE (deprioritize)?"
input.new_string:
# Mission

I identify the highest-value AI opportunities in our enterprise, prove they work through code-assisted prototypes, and orchestrate the organization to adopt them. I bridge the gap between what's scientifically possible and what's organizationally achievable.

My value is not in doing the science or building the models — it's in **judgment** (knowing WHAT to build), **influence** (getting it funded and adopted), and **governance** (knowing what's safe and compliant in healthcare). These skills stay valuable as AI building becomes commoditized.

**Career Trajectory:** IC (Product/Strategy) → AI Innovation Lead (12-18 mo) → Sr. AI Strategy Lead (3-5 yr) → Director/VP AI Strategy (5-8 yr) → Chief AI/Innovation Officer (8-12 yr)

**Strategic Filter (2026-02-07):** I focus exclusively on projects that benefit from the exponential increase in AI capabilities. I deprioritize any project where the work will be obsolete within 3 months due to AI advancement. The test is binary: "Will AI's growth make this work MORE valuable (pursue) or OBSOLETE (deprioritize)?"

**Post-Commoditization Filter (2026-02-08):** When evaluating my own skill development, I ask: "Will this skill be more valuable or less valuable when anyone can prototype AI solutions?" I invest disproportionately in what stays scarce: problem selection judgment, organizational transformation, governance, and trust-based influence.

input.old_string:
## Domain Intersections
I sit at the intersection of three domains that rarely talk to each other:
- **Biology x ML:** I translate between what scientists need and what models can deliver
- **Strategy x Technical Feasibility:** I filter ideas that are interesting but not achievable
- **Regulatory x Innovation:** I flag compliance constraints before they block projects at month 4
input.new_string:
## Domains to Develop

| Domain | Current | Target | Timeline | Why |
|--------|---------|--------|----------|-----|
| Agentic AI / Process Automation | Foundational | Intermediate | Q2-Q3 2026 | Top project interest; must demo credibly |
| Enterprise AI Governance | Foundational | Intermediate | Q2-Q3 2026 | Healthcare = regulated; be the "can we do this?" authority |
| Organizational Change Management | None | Intermediate | Q3-Q4 2026 | The bottleneck when everyone can build; adoption > implementation |
| Enterprise Data Strategy | Foundational | Intermediate | Q3-Q4 2026 | Data moats > model moats; know the enterprise data landscape |
| AI Portfolio Management | None | Intermediate | 2027 | Manage AI bets like a VC; executive trajectory skill |

## Domain Intersections
I sit at the intersection of domains that rarely talk to each other:
- **Biology x ML:** I translate between what scientists need and what models can deliver
- **Strategy x Technical Feasibility:** I filter ideas that are interesting but not achievable
- **Regulatory x Innovation:** I flag compliance constraints before they block projects at month 4
- **Technology x Organizational Change:** I understand not just what to build, but how to get 10,000 people to actually use it
- **Domain Expertise x AI Judgment:** When AI prototyping is commoditized, deep domain knowledge + strategic judgment becomes the differentiator
